bibl.title: Textile and Papyrus Figurines from Karanis.
bibl.note: Physical features. - Three figurine contexts at Karanis. - Comparative material. - Interpreting the Karanis dolls. - "The analysis seems to point in the direction of the child's world. It may be that these figurines were playthings; amulets they may have been; perhaps, in fact, they had a multidimensional meaning and function, encompassing the worlds of leisure and ritual. In any case, the textile and papyrus figurines from Karanis represent a tradition unparalleled elsewhere in Roman Egypt."
bibl.seg: Johnson Karen, Textile and Papyrus Figurines from Karanis.

It may be that these figurines were playthings; amulets they may have been; perhaps, in fact, they had a multidimensional meaning and function, encompassing the worlds of leisure and ritual. In any case, the textile and papyrus figurines from Karanis represent a tradition unparalleled elsewhere in Roman Egypt."
